title: What is Absinthe?  Myth, History, and Resurrection - Opening and Drinking from a 100 Year Old Bottle
description:
No spirit is more evocative of the occult and the esoteric than the Green Fairy or Absinthe.  Inspiration to dozens of artists and poets including luminaries like Ernest Hemingway, James Joyce, Charles Baudelaire, Paul Verlaine, Arthur Rimbaud, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, Pablo Picasso, Vincent van Gogh, Oscar Wilde, Marcel Proust, Aleister Crowley, and Alfred Jarry absinthe has a reputation like no other spirits.  Thought to cause madness and hallucinations, most of absinthe's history is shrouded in myth.  Join Esoteric as we explore this spirit, discuss Aleister Crowley's essay "The Green Goddess" and actually open and sip from a 100 year old bottle of real, vintage absinthe.

Recommended Reading: 

Crowley - The Green Goddess - https://www.absinthes.com/absinthe-encyclopedia/absinthe-in-america/aleister-crowley-the-green-goddess/
Conrad III - Absinthe: History in a Bottle - 978-0811816502
Wittels & Breaux - Absinthe: The Exquisite Elixir - 978-1682750018
Chemical Composition of Vintage Preban Absinthe - https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/jf703568f

Find Ted: https://www.vintageabsinthe.com/
Purchase his wonderful Absinthe here: https://www.absinthes.com/search?sSearch=jade
Find Marc & Buy Vintage / Pre-Ban Absinthe - https://www.absintheoriginals.com/vintage_absinthe.html

#absinthe #spirits #vintage

title: Absinthe w Marc Thuillier - Discovering and Tasting Vintage & Pre-Ban Bottles of Absinthe
description: Absinthe was banned in France in 1915 and began to vanish from the world.  Despite the ban, bottles survived in hidden cellars and secret stashes.  I still down with the world's leading expert on vintage and pre-ban Absinthe to discuss finding and sampling these most precious treasures.  This is part of my series on absinthe where I open and sample a 100 year bottle myself!

title: Absinthe w Ted Breaux of Jade Liqueurs - History Myth Science and Distillation of Authentic Absinthe
description:
Interview with master distiller, scientist and absinthe pioneer Ted Breaux where we discuss the myth and history of absinthe, its birth, death and resurrection.  Does absinthe cause madness or insanity?  Where did these myths come from?  How is authentic absinthe made and how did it become legal again?  A wonderful conversation and part of Esoterica's series on absinthe.

Find Ted: https://www.vintageabsinthe.com/
Purchase his wonderful Absinthe here: https://www.absinthes.com/search?sSearch=jade

title: The Egyptian Book of Thoth - Real Ancient Egyptian Initiation Ritual  - Hermetic Philosophy
description:
Thoth was the ancient Egyptian god of wisdom, magic and writing and the legendary revealer of the Hermetic philosophy in the form of Hermes Trismegistus.  Preserved in around 30 Demotic fragments is the ritual by which a priest-scribe became initiated into the service of Thoth to serve in the House of Life or an Egyptian Temple.  In this episode of Esoterica, we explore this complex and ancient text describing the inner sanctum of the "Chamber of Darkness," the complex mystical exams the initiate undergoes, travels to the Sun and the Netherworld, and more.  I also explore the connections between this text and the ancient Greek Religious-Philosophical text of the Corpus Hermeticum and Hermetic Philosophy.

Recommended Reading:

Jasnow & Zauzich - Conversations in the House of Life - 978-3447101165
Teeter - Religion and Ritual in Ancient Egypt - 978-0521613002
Lichtheim - Ancient Egyptian Literature (3 vol) - 978-0520248427

#thoth #hermetic #egyptian

title: Kabbalah + Alchemy + Magic - The Refiner's Fire - אש מצרף - Transmutation  & Jewish Mystical Theurgy
description:
Alchemy and Kabbalah are a match made in heaven.  In this episode we explore a text which combines alchemy, kabbalah and magic into a united theory of both mystical theurgy and the transformation of nature - the Esh M'tzaref or The Refiner's Fire ( אש מצרף ).  Here we find gematria, magic squares and an amazing combination of alchemical theory and practice along with synthesized with the sefirot of the Kabbalah and just a dash of magic!

title: Babylonian Magic - The Maqlu Ritual - Invoking the Gods to Destroy Evil Magic
description:
The Maqlu ritual is an ancient Mesoptoamian ritual invoking the Shamash, the god of the sun and justice, the destroy those that work evil magic and to unbind that sorcery.  This ancient, 3000 year old ritual, is among the most complex forms of counter-magic known in the world.  Join me as I explore this fascinating magical ritual!

#babylon #magic #maqlu

title: Abramelin - Introduction to the Magical Text and the Ritual made famous by Aleister Crowley
description:
The Book of Abramelin purports to be a text of 15th century magic with a wide range of effects though, most importantly in modern occultism, communication with one's Holy Guardian Angel.  The famous famous undertaking of these rituals was performed by Aleister Crowley at House Boleskine around the dawn of the 20th century.  In this episode of Esoterica, we explore this fascinating texts, its rituals and history.

Support Boleskine House:

https://www.boleskinehouse.org/

Also, you can support Boleskine by buying fragments of the former structure!  I did, it's fun to own some of the former Oratory where Crowley did the Abramelin.

title: Boleskine House - From Aleister Crowley to the Future  - Boleskine House Foundation Interview
description:
Boleskine House is most famous as the site of Aleister Crowley's attempt of the Abramelin Operation.  Of course, there's so much more to the site.  As part of of our exploration of the Abramelin Operation I interview Keith Reddy and Elin Morgan of the Boleskine House Foundation about the history, destruction, renovation and future of this grand Scottish home.

Support Boleskine House:

https://www.boleskinehouse.org/

title: Corpus Hermeticum II - Hermetic Fragments & Testimonies - From Nag Hammadi to the Kore Kosmou
description:
In this episode of Esoterica we are going to introduce and explore the Hermetic Writings that survive outside the classic Greek tractates and the Latin Asclepius.  Here we discover a staggering diversity of texts and traditions all of which give us a better glimpse onto the the spiritual philosophy of Hermeticism.  In this episode we explore the Three Hermetic tracts in the Nag Hammadi Library, the copious Stobaean Fragments, Armenian Hermetic Definitions, Oxford and Vienna Papyri and an overview of the General Fragments and Testimonies about Hermes Trismegistus and the "Way of Hermes."

Recommended Reading:

Also see my reading list on the first Corpus Hermetcum episode for more readings on this topic!

#hermetic #hermeticism #gnosticism

title: Kabbalah - Sefer Bahir ( Book of Illumination ) & The Iyyun Circle - Early History and Introduction
description:
Kabbalah has become, in many ways, the theology of Judaism and one of the pillars of esoteric spirituality more generally.  Despite this, the origins of the Kabbalah remain mysterious.  In this episode of Esoterica we explore some of the earliest texts, groups, and figures of the early Kabbalah including the Unique Cherub Circle, the Sefer Bahir and the Iyyun (Contemplation) circle.

Recommended Reading:

Dan - The Early Kabbalah - 978-0809127696
Verman - The Books of Contemplation - 978-0791407202
Kaplan - Sefer Bahir (w/ caveats) - 978-0877286189

#kabbalah #bahir #zohar

title: Gnosticism - Thunder Perfect Mind - Divine Feminine - Gender, Paradox and Violence
description:
One of the most enigmatic and alluring text in the Nag Hammadi Library of Gnostic texts is the famed hymn-poem Thunder: Perfect Mind.  This episode explores the origins, structure, parallels with an eye to  Thunder's treatment of gender, language and colonialism.  We also explore to what degree we can call Thunder 'gnostic' at all - why did this document survive in the Nag Hammadi library at all?

Recommended Readings:

Thunder: Perfect Mind - https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/shows/religion/maps/primary/thunder.html
Taussig, etc. - The Thunder: Perfect Mind: A New Translation and Introduction - 978-0230105638
Prada Ad - https://www.prada.com/us/en/pradasphere/films/2005/thunder-perfect-mind.html

#gnosticism #gnostic #hermeticism

title: Roman Ghost Story - Pliny and the Stoic in a Haunted House - Read in Latin
description:
There is a longstanding tradition - though nearly extinct now - of telling ghost stories around Christmas-time.  In this episode of Esoterica we are going to conjure the tradition up by exploring a Roman ghost story recounted by Pliny the Younger.  Here we find a Stoic philosopher in a house haunted by a chain-shaking specter.  We'll discover all the classic haunted house tropes here dating back nearly 2000 years!  I'll also be reading the tale aloud in both Latin and English if you want to hear it as well.

Recommended Reading:

Pliny's letters in Latin - http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Plin.+Ep.+7.27

The Latter in English - http://www.attalus.org/old/pliny7.html (scroll down to the Sura )

Ogden - Magic, Witchcraft and Ghosts in the Greek and Roman Worlds - 978-0195385205

#latin #ghoststory #stoicism

title: Gnosticism - The Apocryphon of John - The Fall of Sophia and Origins of the Demiurge Ialdabaoth
description:
Gnosticism has produced some of the richest and most difficult spiritual texts of the ancient world.  With the discovery of the Nag Hammadi library one is confronted with numerous, often obscure and difficult texts - where to begin?  This episode of Esoterica argues that the best first text is the Apocryphon / Secret Writing of John, a text found two recensions (long and short) in four manuscripts from antiquity.  Here we introduce, summarize and discuss this amazing gnostic text.

Recommended Readings:

Meyer - The Nag Hammadi Scriptures - 978-0061626005
Robinson - The Nag Hammadi Library - 978-0060669355
Davies - The Secret Book of John - 978-1594730825
King - The Secret Revelation of John - 978-0674030558
van den Broek - Gnostic Religion in Antiquity - 978-1107514799
Lambdin - Introduction to Sahidic Coptic - 978-0865540484
Williams - Rethinking "Gnosticism": An Argument for Dismantling a Dubious Category - 978-0691005423

#gnosticism #gnostic #apocryphon

title: Ancient Angel Magic - The Sword of Moses - Harba de‐Moshe - Early Text of Jewish Magic
description:
The Sword of Moses is a c. 700-1000 CE text of Jewish angel magic which employs an elaborate system of magical words to activate various angelic powers.  Indeed, the text itself is said to have been gifted to Moses by the angels themselves.  In this episode of Esoterica we explore this ancient magical text, discuss the system of magical words, and detail some of the spells found in this curious text.

Recommend Readings:

Harari - The Sword of Moses (translation) - https://www.academia.edu/9792877/The_Sword_of_Moses_Harba_de_Moshe_A_New_Translation_and_Introduction_2012_
The Sword of Moses (Aramaic - Gaster MS) - https://www.hebrewbooks.org/20266
Debate between Moses and the Angels - Babylonian Talmud 88B and following - https://www.sefaria.org/Shabbat.89a?lang=bi
View an manuscript of the Sword of Moses - https://www.e-codices.unifr.ch/en/bge/cl0145/60/0/
Harari - Jewish Magic before the Rise of Kabbalah - 978-0814336304
Bohak - Ancient Jewish Magic - 978-0521180986

#magic #angel #judaism

title: Alchemy - Origins of Alchemy in Europe - First Alchemy Book - The Composition of Alchemy ( 1144 )
description:
Alchemy is one of the more obscure aspect of western esotericism and the history of science.  In this episode of Esoterica, we explore the first known European alchemical text The Book of the Composition of Alchemy (Liber de compositione alchemiae) translated from the Kitab al-Kimya (from the circle of Jabbir ibn Hayyan c. 8th CE) by Robert of Chester on February 11th 1144.  The book features in microcosm much that will become commonplace in the alchemical tradition:  romantic tales of holy masters, the stone of the philosophers, the transmutation of substances, the famous Green Lion, and more.  By studying this foundational alchemical text we may better understand the history of alchemy and chemistry.

Recommended Reading and Links:

Stavenhagen - A Testament Of Alchemy - 978-0874510959
Al-Hassan - THE ARABIC ORIGINAL OF LIBER DE COMPOSITIONE ALCHEMIAE The Epistle of Maryānus, the Hermit and Philosopher, to Prince Khālid ibn Yazīd - https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/arabic-sciences-and-philosophy/article/abs/arabic-original-of-liber-de-compositione-alchemiae-the-epistle-of-maryanus-the-hermit-and-philosopher-to-prince-khalid-ibn-yazid/BD9E8994AF1B205A13B1498DE548DCA5
Auriferae artis (Latin text) - https://www.google.com/books/edition/Auriferae_artis_quam_chemiam_vocant_anti/A2FWAAAAcAAJ?hl=en&gbpv=0
Alchemy website - https://www.alchemywebsite.com/
Purchase some of Adam McLean's art - https://www.ebay.com/str/Esoteric-paintings

Linden, Stanton J. (ed.) The Alchemy Reader: From Hermes Trismegistus to Isaac Newton.  978-0521796620.  Nicely edited collection of alchemical primary texts.
Principe, Lawrence.  The Secrets of Alchemy.  978-0226103792.  An up-to-date history of alchemy.
Newman, William.  Newton the Alchemist: Science, Enigma, and the Quest for Nature's "Secret Fire" 978-0691174877.  Cutting edge research on alchemy in the 17th century. 
Roob, Alexander(ed.) Alchemy & Mysticism.   978-3836549363.  A collection of alchemical imagery and symbolism, also a nice coffee table book!

Spiritual / Psychology School of Interpretation 

Atwood, Mary Anne.  A Suggestive Inquiry into the Hermetic Mystery….(many re-print editions).  The first text to introduce the ‘spiritual interpretation” of alchemy.
Eliade, Mircea.  The Forge and the Crucible: The Origins and Structure of Alchemy. 978-0226203904.  Religious-philosophical interpretation of alchemy.
von Franz, Marie-Louise.  Alchemy: An Introduction to the Symbolism and the Psychology. 978-0919123045.  An introduction to the Jungian psychological interpretation of alchemy.

#alchemy #hermetic #transmutation

title: Winter Seminar - Philosophical Foundations of the Corpus Hermeticum  + Celebrating 10K Subscribers!
description: Just a short video celebrating 10 subscribers and announcing the topic of the winter seminar - The Philosophical Foundations of the Corpus Hermeticum.  Thanks to everyone who supports the channel - I'm so happy to have reached 10k in only 8 months!  Thanks especially to the patrons of the channel.

title: The Occult in Colonial America - Magic Divination Astrology & Alchemy
description:
While Puritan spirituality and the Witch Hunts dominate our view of the colonial period of North America, history reveals that a range of occult practices flourished.  From magic, astrology, alchemy and various forms of divination - there is plenty of evidence for early American occultism.  In this episode of Esoterica, we explore this dimension of early American history.

Recommended Readings:

Godbeer - The Devil's Dominion - 978-0521466707
Butler - Awash in a Sea of Faith - 978-0674056015
Newman - Gehennical Fire - 978-0226577142
Woodward - Prospero's America - 978-1469600871
Works by George Starkey / Eirenaeus Philalethes - https://archive.org/details/collectaneachymi00phil

#magic #alchemy #america #salem

title: Kabbalah and Magic in the Renaissance : Hermetic Prophetic & Magical Kabbalah in Jochanan Alemanno
description:
While not as famous as other kabbalists Jochanan Alemanno has exercised a substantial influence over the development of both Christian and Hermetic Kabbalah through his student Giovanni Pico Mirandola.  In this episode of Esoterica we explore a Kabbalistic study guide written by Alemanno which progresses from basic literacy, rabbinic literature, philosophy, alchemy, to kabbalah and finally magic.  Here we find a fascinating fusion of magic and kabbalah which opens the door for much in later occult philosophy and practice.

Recommended Reading:

Idel - Kabbalah in Italy, 1280-1510 - 978-0300126266
Novak - Giovanni Pico della Mirandola and Jochanan Alemanno -https://www.jstor.org/stable/750969

#kabbalah #magic #hermeticism

title: Ancient Christian Magic - Protection, Exorcism, and Love Magic from Ancient Coptic Texts
description:
While Christianity is often thought of as hostile to any form of magical practice, history reveals that magic has been practiced through all of Christian history.  In this episode of Esoterica we explore the earliest Christian magic preserved in Greek and Coptic sources from late-classical Egypt.  Here we find a wide range of magical practices from protection, exorcisms, love magic, curses - even a spell for a good singing voice.  Studying early Christian magic gives us an important glimpse into a wider range of Christianity than just the world of theologians, monks, and priests.

Recommending Readings:

Meyer and Smith - Ancient Christian Magic - 978-0691004587
Coptic Magical Papyri - https://www.coptic-magic.phil.uni-wuerzburg.de/

#magic #christian #coptic

title: Gnostic Baptism Ritual from the Book of Jeu - Pistis Sophia - Nag Hammadi Library - Gnosticism
description:
While texts from the Nag Hammadi library have revolutionized our understanding of Gnosticism, we still know very little about just how Gnosticism was practiced in the ancient world.  What were their rituals, hymns, gatherings, and daily life like?  In this episode of Esoterica we explore a Gnostic Baptism ritual found in the Bruce Codex Book of Jeu.  What we find is a complex set of rituals by which one purifies one's soul in order to begin one's ascent back to the divine One.  We also explore the various layers of reality described in the Jeu I and some connections with ancient magic.

Recommended Readings:

Schmidt - The Books of Jeu and the Untitled Text in the Bruce Codex - 978-9004057548
Evans - The Books of Jeu and the Pistis Sophia as Handbooks to Eternity - 978-9004284463
Lambdin - Introduction to Sahidic Coptic - 978-0865540484
DeConick  (ed.) - Practicing Gnosis: Ritual, Magic, Theurgy and Liturgy in Nag Hammadi, Manichaean and Other Ancient Literature - 978-9004256293
Thunder Perfect Mind Prada Ad - https://www.prada.com/us/en/pradasphere/films/2005/thunder-perfect-mind.html

#gnostic #Baptism #Jeu

title: The Devil Rides Out - The Devil's Bride - Occult Film Review & Analysis
description:
The Devil Rides Out or the The Devil's Bride as it was known in the US is a seminal occult film.  Unlike many other films which feature occult or esoteric themes, there is actually a substantial amount of research reflected in this film base emerging from the 1934 novel of the same name by Dennis Wheatley. In this more light-hearted episode of Esoterica, we explore this classic 1968 Hammer film with an eye to the occult material in the film itself.

#occultism #film #hammer

title: Witches Witch-Hunting and Magic in Early-Modern Europe (FIA Lecture)
description:
This lecture explore, briefly, the history of witches, the witch-hunts, and the development of magic in early-modern Europe and could serve as a general introduction to the topic.  Many thanks to the Flint Institute of Arts and Dr. Alan Klein for sponsoring the lecture.

#witch #witchhunt #demonology

title: What is the Dybbuk ?  Spirit Possession and Exorcism in the Kabbalah
description:
The Kabbalah changed a great deal in Judaism including the conception of possession and exorcism.  This episode of Esoterica explores the development of these concepts in rabbinical Judaism and the rise of Kabbalah, especially Lurianic Kabbalah in the 16th century.   Here we discuss the idea of the Dybbuk - the evil dead returned to possess the living - but also the idea of Ibbur or beneficent spiritual pregnancy in which the soul of the righteous dead actually comes to dwell in the body of the kabbalist!  

Recommended Reading:

Ansky - The Dybbuk - 978-1494837532
Chajes - Between Worlds: Dybbuks, Exorcists, and Early Modern Judaism - 978-0812221701
Goldish - Spirit Possession in Judaism - 978-0814330036
Elior - Dybbuks and Jewish Women in Social History, Mysticism and Folklore - 978-9655240078

Der Dybbuk Film - https://www.jewishfilm.org/Catalogue/films/dybbuk.html
Dimona Dybbuk Exorcism Video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DSWkfabZApU

#kabbalah #dybbuk #exorcism

title: Possession and Exorcism in Ancient Israel - Judaism
description:
While it is often forgotten, Judaism has a long history in the development and history of spiritual / demonic possession and exorcism.  In this episode of Esoteric, we explore the first 1000 years of this developments.  From Ancient Israel and their neighbors, the Egyptians and Mesopotamians, we explore the rise of angels and demons in the apocalyptic movement, before turning to explore several major figures such as the Essenes, Jesus of Nazareth, Philo of Alexandria, and the Roman-Jewish historian Josephus.  What we will find is the complicated development of possession and exorcism through the centuries of Jewish religious culture.   

Recommend Reading:

Oesterreich - Possession and Exorcism - 978-0883560358
Borghouts - Ancient Egyptian Magical Texts - 978-9004058484
Hrusa - Ancient Mesopotamian Religion - 978-3868351187
Witmer - Jesus, the Galilean Exorcist - 978-0567575524

#possession #exorcism #jewish

title: Alchemy - Where to Begin - Introduction to the Summa Perfectionis (Sum of Perfection) Pseudo-Geber
description:
Alchemy is one of the most difficult fields of study in Western Esotericism for a host of reasons: texts are often in ancient languages, practically encoded, full of arcane symbolism and obscure instructions.  One of the most daunting tasks is even where to begin.  There are thousands of alchemical texts spread over 1500 years - which is the best starting point if you want to study alchemy?  In this episode of Esoterica, we argue that the Summa Perfectionis (c. 1310) is the best answer.  We explore the question of the text's authorship, transmission, composition, alchemical theory of substance, change, and, of course, metallic transmutation.

Recommended Readings

Newman - The Summa Perfectionis of Pseudo-Geber: A Critical Edition, Translation, and Study - 978-9004094642 (ILL this one)

Summa Perfectionis (Latin Reprint of 1542 edition) - 978-0282332815 - read online - https://archive.org/details/geberisphilosoph00gebe/mode/2up

Works of Geber (including the Summa Perfectionis) (English translation of 1678 reprinted in 1928)   978-1162568676 - read online - https://archive.org/details/WorksOfGeber/mode/2up

Other Readings:

Principe, Lawrence.  The Secrets of Alchemy.  978-0226103792.  An up-to-date history of alchemy.

title: The Three Books of Occult Philosophy - Cornelius Agrippa - Renaissance Hermeticism Cabala and Magic
description:
Cornelius Agrippa's 1533 The Three Books of Occult Philosophy is, perhaps, the most famous magical tome in western history.  In it, he describes the process by which the magus may return to their prelapsarian, semi-divine state through the process of a reformed natural, celestial and ceremonial magic.  Neither a textbook nor a summa, this work is often more celebrated or maligned than actually understood.  What does Agrippa actually teach?  How do we square his Hermetic idealism with his otherwise radically skeptical attitudes in his other major work of this period?  This episode of Esoterica examines this (in)famous text of magic, astrology and cabala.

#agrippa #occult #philosophy #magic

title: Celebrating 5,000 Subscribers + Channel News + Winter Seminar & Summer Class Patreon Goals !
description:
My sincere thanks to all the subscribers to the channel and especially to our patrons.  We hit my 1 year goals for the channel in the first six months - I am humbled and blown away.  I had no idea starting this channel it would be noticed at all - Thanks so much.

Head over to Patreon to support the new goals for the channel!  Same content (hopefully better!) will continue with new goals!

New Goals - Support Esoterica Here - https://www.patreon.com/esotericachannel

Winter 2020 Seminar - This goal will allow me to host a 2020/1 winter seminar on a topic set by my patrons and enjoyed by you!  My goal is to provide a reader, discussion group, and 1.5 hour long sessions over the course of 4-5 weeks deeply exploring a text or topic in Western Western Esotericism in addition to my weekly content.  This will also support my longer term goal of teaching a university level Introduction to Western Esotericism course next summer!

Next Summer Class - My goal here is to get enough support to teach a university level Introduction to Western Esotericism and Hermetic Philosophy course next summer spanning an entire academic semester starting in May and ending in August.  We could meet twice a week for lectures and discussion.  I would provide a pdf reader for the class along with discussions and office hours.  It would be a fully online course with the sessions available to the public as well - a real attempt in totally open, crowdfunded education on one of the most difficult to find fields in academia.

title: John Dee - The Monas Heiroglyphica - Part III - Metaphysical Power & Symbolism
description:
In our final installment of our series on John Dee's famous 1564 Monas Hieroglyphica or the Hieroglyphic Monad we explore how metaphysical power and symbolism are fused in the glyph itself.  By locating Dee's thinking in the realist trajectory of Medieval, Renaissance and Hermetic philosophy, we hope to reveal how Dee fused both semiotics (the study of symbols and representation) with ontology (the study of being itself) in a grand effort to both correct all knowledge but also reform reality itself - what Dee calls "The Cabala of What is" or the "Cabala of Reality."  This episode also explore how Dee continued this project even during the famous angelic conversations.

Episode I - https://youtu.be/2meS9-YGYhU
Episode II - https://youtu.be/lEwK1dmco3I

These episodes represent a more introductory version of my thesis on the Monas Hieroglyphica prepared at the University of Amsterdam.

You can read the entire thesis here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9iShqG1gJavUXVKVnk2d1UzQVE/view?usp=sharing

Standard text and translation of the Monas Hieroglyphica -  C. H. Josten, Ambix, 12:2-3 (1964): 82-221

#dee #enochian #monas

title: Dead Sea Scrolls : Encoded Cryptic Astrological Calendar & Copper Treasure Scrolls
description:
The Dead Sea Scrolls are one of the most spectacular and important archaeological finds of all time.  While the Biblical, Non-Canonical and Sectarian texts are more or less well known there remains many esoteric texts have also surfaced.  In this episode of Esoterica we explore the enciphered calendar texts traceable to the Book of Enoch, the oldest astrological texts in Judaism,  divination by thunder, encoded sectarian texts and even a treasure map cryptically detailing the location of over 100 tons of gold and silver.

Recommended Readings:

Collins - The Dead Sea Scrolls: A Biography - 978-0691191713
Vermes - The Complete Dead Sea Scrolls in English - 978-0141197319
Lim & Collins - The Oxford Handbook of the Dead Sea Scrolls - 978-0199663088
Stern - Calendars in Antiquity: Empires, States, and Societies - 978-0199589449
Ben-Dov - Head of All Years: Astronomy and Calendars at Qumran in Their Ancient Context - 978-9004170889
Discoveries in the Judaean Desert - https://global.oup.com/academic/content/series/d/discoveries-in-the-judaean-desert-djd/
and Articles by Stephen Pfann

#deadseascrolls #astrology #treasure

title: Medieval Magic - Scholastic Analysis of Magic and Necromancy in the Middle Ages
description:
Scholasticism was the greatest intellectual movement of the Middle Ages.  In this episode of Esoterica we explore the attitudes of medieval philosophers, theologians and scientists concerning magic.  From Augustine where magic is a demonic deception to the rise of natural magic and medieval necromancy we will see that just beneath the surface there is a great deal of subtlety among these thinkers.  Further, we will also notice that necromancy and black magic are always at the edges acceptable theory and practice.

Recommended Readings:

Kieckhefer - Magic in the Middle Ages - 978-1107431829
Thorndike - History of Magic and Experimental Science vol. 2
Magic in History Series - Penn State

#magic #medieval #demons

title: The Witch Trials and the Rise of Modernity and Capitalism - Sylvia Federici - Caliban and the Witch
description:
In this episode of Esoterica we explore Sylvia Federici's thesis that the witch trials, rather than being a peripheral event in European history, were pivotal in the transition to capitalism and modernity.  She argues that the social instability of the middle ages was tipped into social chaos with the advent of the Black Death.  In the aftermath, ruling powers sought to suppress workers' uprisings, women's autonomy, and peasant rebellions.  The witch hunts served this task and beta-tested, so to speak, the social and legal procedures which would later be unleashed upon the indigenous people of the new world and African slaves.

Recommended Readings:

Federici - Caliban and the Witch - 978-1570270598
Federici - Witches, Witch-Hunting, and Women - 978-1629635682
Levack - The Witch-Hunt in Early Modern Europe - 978-1138808102
Levack, ed. - The Witchcraft Sourcebook - 978-1138774971
Levack, ed. - The Oxford Handbook of Witchcraft in Early Modern Europe and Colonial America - 978-0198723639
Peters and Kors, ed. - Witchcraft in Europe, 400-1700 - 978-0812217513

#federici #witches #trials

title: Sefer Yetzirah - Book of Formation - Introduction to a Core Early Text of Kabbalah Cabala Qabbalah
description:
The Sefer Yetzirah is perhaps the oldest text of what would become the Jewish Mysticism known as the Kabbalah.  Though, virtually everything about this brief text is a mystery.  When was it written, by whom and exactly what it means are all hotly debated topics by academics, kabbalists and occultists.  Indeed, the text is so linked with magical power that commentaries on the text describe how one might construct artificial life itself in the form of the famed Golem.  This episode explores the origin, development and contents of this elusive but profound mystical text

Gershom Scholem - Kabbalah - 978-0452010079 (dated but still useful)
Tzahi Weiss - Sefer Yesirah and Its Contexts - 978-0812249903
Peter Hayman - Sefer Yesira: Edition, Translation and Text-critical Commentary - 978-3161483813 (ILL this one)
Don Karr - Notes on Editions of Sefer Yetzirah in English - https://www.academia.edu/22875900/Notes_on_Editions_of_Sefer_Yetzirah_in_English
Aryeh Kaplan  - Sefer Yetzirah: The Book of Creation - 978-0877286905 (Lurianic perspective)
Sefer Yetzirah HaShalem - Harav Moshe Tzuriel - (check seforim stores)

#kabbalah #yetzirah #golem

title: Magic in Ancient Israel & the Hebrew Bible - Divination Necromancy Amulets and the Witch of Endor
description:
Ancient Israel is one of the most studied cultures of the ancient world.  Though, one understudied aspect of their society was the practice of magic.  This episode of Esoteric explores what little archaeological and literary evidence remains for the study of ancient Israelite magic.  Here we will look at silver amulets found in Jerusalem's tombs and dive into the Hebrew Bible to try to understand the forms of magic that are typically forbidden there.  Here we will find various forms of divination and necromancy including the infamous account of the so-called "Witch of Endor."  

Recommended Readings:
Yuval Harari  - Jewish Magic before the Rise of Kabbalah - 978-0814336304
Gideon Bohak - Ancient Jewish Magic - 978-0521180986
Joshua Trachtenberg - Jewish Magic and Superstition - 978-1614274070 - Dated, proceed critically!

#magic #bible #judaism

title: Medieval Mystical Women - The Beguines - Hadewijch Mechthild of Magdeburg & Marguerite Porete
description:
The typical view of the middle ages is one of cultural, intellectual and religious stagnation.  This is hardly the truth.  The European Middle ages were marked by innovations at almost every cultural register including spirituality.  This episode explores the radical and probing mystical spirituality of the Beguines, a lay culture of women who worked in the skilled trades, publicly preached, aided the poor and destitute, all as part of their own autonomous spiritual vocation.  These women were also extraordinary mystics and theologians.  We briefly explore three of these amazing women here: Hadewijch of Antwerp, Mechthild of Magdeburg & Marguerite Porete to reveal how their mysticism abounds in love, light, madness, and annihilation.

This episode is also a collaboration with my colleague Filip Holm over at Let's Talk Religion where he will be exploring the role of women in Sufism / Islamic Mysticism.  Check out his video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cVSZaxcg6RY

#mysticism #beguine #women

Recommended Readings:

Hadewijch: The Complete Works - 978-0809122974
Marguerite Porete: The Mirror of Simple Souls - 978-0809134274
Mechthild of Magdeburg: The Flowing Light of the Godhead - 978-0809137763
Swan - The Wisdom of the Beguines - 978-1629190082
McGinn - The Flowering of Mysticism - 978-0824517434

title: Corpus Hermeticum - Introduction to Hermes Trismegistus & Hermetic Philosophy
description:
The Corpus Hermeticum are the texts and teachings ascribed to the legendary Egyptian sage, priest, and philosopher Hermes Trismegistus.  When translated and published by Ficino in 1471 these texts were heralded as the very source of pure, perennial wisdom.  In the subsequent years, these ideas went on to have a massive impact upon what is now called western esotericism.  Just what are these teaching?  What is the history of the text?  How did this pagan wisdom survive into modernity?  In this episode of Esoterica we introduce the Corpus Hermeticum, Hermes Trismegistus & Hermetic Philosophy.

Reccomended Reading:

Dillion - The Middle Platonists: 80 B.C. to A.D. 220 - 978-0801483165
Copenhaver - Hermetica - 978-0521425438
Litwa - Hermetica II - 978-1107182530
Salaman, van Oyen, Wharto,  Mahe - The Way of Hermes - 978-0892811861
van Bladel - The Arabic Hermes - 978-0195376135
Fowden - The Egyptian Hermes - 978-0691024981
Festugière  - La révélation d'Hermès Trismégiste - 978-2251326740

title: The Lesser Key of Solomon - History of Solomonic Magic and Goetia - Check out updated 2023 video!
description:
Solomon has been associated with both exoteric and esoteric wisdom - especially magic and control of demons - for millennia.  This Episode of Esoterica explores the history of Solomonic magic and the it's most famous expression in the Lemegeton or The Lesser Key of Solomon.  We will deep dive into the history of Solomon as a sorcerer, the development of Solomonic Magic, and the composition and structure of the major parts of the Lesser Key, especially the infamous book of demonic conjuring the Goetia.

Check out the updated video here - https://youtu.be/d3DmMeJX-io

Check out Angela's episode: https://youtu.be/8WJzCwK6Hus

Recommended Reading:

#goetia #magic #occultism

title: Magic and Disease - Thinking about the history of magic in the time of COVID-19
description:
Human beings have fought disease since the dawn of history employing a wide range of tools especially including magic.  This episode of Esoterica is a brief tour of some of the magical tools, spells, charms, and amulets magician-doctors have used in their fight against illness through the ages.  We begin at the dawn of civilization in ancient Nippur and travel through the times of the Greco-Egyptians, the black death, medieval Christian England, the Renaissance before ending with a Jewish angelic incantation against illness printed in Amsterdam in 1701.  Of course, this is only a glimpse of the enormous anti-disease magic out there but I hope it provide some historical and human insight into this ongoing struggle with COVID-19 we are all enduring.  I hope you and your loved ones stay safe out there!

#magic #disease #history

title: Egyptian Alchemy : Decoding the Greek - Egyptian Alchemy - The Formula of the Crab / Scorpion
description:
Alchemy is, perhaps, best known for it's elaborate symbolism but just how far back into history can we trace these allegories, secret codes, and hidden meanings? In this episode of Esoterica we investigate what is likely one of the earliest encoded alchemical texts:  "the Formula of the Crab" or "the Formula of the Scorpion."  Found in a 10th century Greek manuscript, this formula contain a Greco-Egyptian  alchemical process for producing a gold-like alloy of copper, silver, and lead.  As we explore the formula we will also discuss how Greco-Egyptian alchemy differed from later theories under the influence of the mercury-sulfur theory of the metals.  What will discover is an emphasis on the ability to control the color of metals as opposed to metallic transmutation reflecting the religious vocation of the earliest Egyptian metallurgists.

Recommended Reading: 

M. Berthelot - Collection des anciens alchimistes grecs - https://archive.org/details/collectiondesanc23bert/mode/2up

S. Linden - The Alchemy Reader: From Hermes Trismegistus to Isaac Newton - 978-0521796620

S. Grimes - Becoming Gold: Zosimos of Panopolis and the Alchemical Arts in Roman Egypt - 978-0473407759

#alchemy #egypt #hermeticism

title: Ancient Angel Magic - Sefer HaRazim - The Book of Secrets - Jewish Magic
description:
The Sefer HaRazim ( Book of Secrets / Mysteries) is an ancient Jewish book of angel magic dating to the 3rd or 4th century CE.  It was discovered in the Cairo Genizah in the 1960's in fragments and was edited together over the course of three years by Mordecai‏ Margalioth.  In the text we find descriptions of the seven heavens, angelic military formations, and magical spells corresponding to the various heavens and angels.  Sefer HaRazim is an interesting combination of both Merkabah mysticism (in which mystics 'descend' to the throne of the Divine through the palaces of G-d) and the sophisticated technologies of Greco-Egyptian magic.  This episode explores the text in depth, several of the spells, angelic names and the long-standing impact of this kind of angelic magic on later traditions of magical practice.

Recommended Reading:

Michael Morgan - Sepher Ha-Razim: The Book of Mysteries - 978-0891306153
Margalioth, Mordecai - Sepher Ha-Razim -  Jerusalem: Yediot Achronot, 1966
Medieval Latin Translation: https://histbest.ub.uni-leipzig.de/rsc/viewer/UBLHistBestCBU_derivate_00000077/cod_mag_40_jpg/cod_mag_40_001.jpg

#angel #magic #judaism

title: Psychedelic Natural Magic - Potions from the 1558 Magiae Naturalis of Giambattista della Porta
description:
While psychoactive substances are a core component in many religious traditions, with the exception of alcohol, they are conspicuously missing from much of the western European context.  Did and how did such substances play a role in religious, philosophy, mysticism, and magic? This episode explores what appears to be an early selection of mind-altering compounds found in the enormously popular 1558 Magiae Naturalis (On Natural Magic). of Giambattista della Porta.  Here della Porta describes four such 'potions,' to use his language, which allegedly cause "pleasant madness for a day" and provide for a range of  phenomenological effects from 'being silly' to 'thinking one an animal or fish."  What role did "potions" like these play beyond recreation - such as the ubiquitous flying ointments of the middle ages?  What does it mean for such "potions" to appear in a book on "natural magic"?

Disclaimer and Plea:  I've blurred out sections which contain specific ingredients, amounts, and processes for creating the 'potions' described by della Porta for reasons of safety. It is highly unadvised to attempt to recreate or ingest anything described in this text.  I also know that early modern translations of this text exist and they are very easy to find.  Please respect my wishes to not reproduce the description (in Latin, English, etc.) for how to make these 'potions' in the comments.  I want encourage safety, responsible consumption of psychoactive substances, and harm reduction and without specialist vetting I can't reproduce these instructions in good conscious.  Comments which violate this request will be deleted.    

Recommended Readings:

Giambattista della Porta - 1558 - Magiae Naturalis (On Natural Magic)  - https://books.google.com/books?id=R6vzpy4WQYMC&pg=PR5#v=onepage&q&f=false

#magic #psychedelics #occultism

title: Necromancy - How to Read a Historical Book of Magic / Necromancy - Reading a Real Necronomicon
description:
This episode celebrates 1000 Subscribers!  This time we answers fans of the channel's request for an analysis of a historical book of magic.  What if you were to stumble onto an actual copy of the something like the Necronomicon of HP Lovecraft / Evil Dead lore?  How would you go about actually reading it?  Here, we discuss at length, the various processes scholars perform to understand medieval books - from book binding, to writing media, to medieval Latin and the complex set of abbreviations that often encode the writing of the middle ages - by looking at a page from CLM 849 or the Munich Necromancer's Manual.  As you will see, this specific spell is uses demonic magic to produce a magical cloak capable of rendering the magus invisible to all all manner of beings.

Recommended Readings:

Richard Kieckhefer - Forbidden Rites: A Necromancer’s Manual of the Fifteenth Century - ISBN-13: 978-0271017518 
Bernhard Bischoff - Latin Palaeography: Antiquity and the Middle Ages - 978-0521367264

You can also enter for the manuscript  just contacting me via my website (https://www.justinsledge.com/contact) with favorite reflections on an episode - I don't this to be strictly based on patron support and that helps to meet legal guidelines so you don't need to pay anything at all to enter!

#magic #necromancy #manuscript

title: The Mystical Dreams of Descartes - Exploring the Origins of Rationalism and Modernity
description:
In this episode we explore the non-rational origins of rationalism by investigating a series of dreams had by Rene Descartes - thought to have founded rationalism and modern philosophy - on the night of November 10/11, 1619.  Early in his career Descartes, like many intellectuals of his day, was searching for new intellectual and scientific foundations as the worldview provided by Aristotle had become moribund.  In this search, Descartes explores many avenues for the truth from strict logic to mystical Rosicrucianism.  In this context, he experiences a profound fit of 'enthusiasm' and has a series of three dreams which ground and propel his own foundationalist project.  This episode explores how the origins of rationalism and modernity are simply more esoteric, even mystical, than we typically learn in intellectual history or philosophy classes.

Recommended Readings:

Adrien Baillet - La vie de Monsieur Descartes - https://archive.org/download/bub_gb_RhNEAAAAcAAJ/bub_gb_RhNEAAAAcAAJ.pdf
John Cottingham - The Philosophical Writings of Descartes in 3 vols.
Alice Browne - Descartes's Dreams -  https://www.jstor.org/stable/750999
Michael Keevak - Descartes's Dreams and Their Address for Philosophy -  https://www.jstor.org/stable/2709883
William Shea - Descartes and the Rosicrucian Enlightenment - Metaphysics and Philosophy of Science in the Seventeenth and Eighteenth Centuries, Pages 73-99
Frances A. Yates - The Rosicrucian Enlightenment, pgs 113 et passim

#descartes #philosophy #rationalism

title: Kabbalah & Zohar - Advice and Tips for Starting to Study the Zohar - the core text of the Kabbalah
description:
I was recently asked about tips for how to start studying the Zohar, the core text in the development of the Jewish Mystical tradition or Kabbalah.  I've been study this incredibly challenging text from both religious and academic perspectives for years and here are some tips and advice for anyone - Jewish, non-Jewish, academic, secular, occultist, or just fan of literature - for starting to study this amazing text.  Also note the links to the texts below including some recommendations for editions to study at any level of Zohar study.

Sample Section of Talmud - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RLHGFBVl79KWYav7HSgAMblU7Q5lOP4RpTBSjm47tA4/edit?usp=sharing

Zohar Editions from Starter to Advanced

Zohar: Annotated & Explained - 978-1893361515 - Best text for absolute beginner
Zohar: The Book of Enlightenment (Classics of Western Spirituality) - 978-0809123872 - More diverse texts, still great for absolute beginner
The Pritzker Zohar in 12 volumes - https://www.sup.org/zohar/ - Best translation in English
Sefer Zohar (Hebrew/Aramaic) - Margaliot 3 volume edition - Standard edition for both Academic and Religious reference
From here, move on to both academic and religious commentaries

The Zohar can be incredibly challenging to study.  Here is a short syllabus in graduated form from easier (Midrash haNe'elam) to more difficult (Idra Rabba) sections:

Midrash haNe'elam / The Hidden Midrash - (2:4a–5b, 14a–22a, 2:35b–40b  46b-47b and volume 11 of the Pritzker Zohar vol. 11 )
The Sava (2:94b–114a - Pritzker Zohar vol. 5) and Yanuka pericopes (3:186a–92a - Pritzker Zohar vol. 9)
The main body of the Zohar - The Introduction being a real challenge
Idra Zuta or the The Lesser Assembly (3:287b–96b - Pritzker Zohar vol. 9)
Sifra di-Tzeni'uta (2:176b–179a - Pritzker Zohar vol. 9)
Idra Rabba or The Greater Assembly (3:127b–145a - Pritzker Zohar vol. 8)

#kabbalah #zohar #mysticism

title: John Dee - The Monas Hieroglyphica - Part II - Alchemy and Cabala
description:
This is the second episode exploring Dr. John Dee's famous 1564 Monas Hieroglyphica.  In this episode we continue our discussion of Dee's Semiotic-Ontology (his link of Representation with Being) by exploring his early theories of alchemy and Cabala.  Dee was a maverick in both fields.  In alchemy, Dee sought to pursue the "Mercury Alone" theory while maintaining a relationship with traditional alchemy and introducing novel Paracelsian elements.  In the field of Cabala, Dee employs traditional Jewish techniques for the manipulation of the Hebrew language to transform the Monad itself.  When Dee combines the talismanic, alchemical, and cabalistic he will seek a "Cabala of Being" which will reform reality itself - the topic of the third episode.

These episodes represent a more introductory version of my thesis on the Monas Hieroglyphica prepared at the University of Amsterdam.

You can read the entire thesis here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9iShqG1gJavUXVKVnk2d1UzQVE/view?usp=sharing

Standard text and translation of the Monas Hieroglyphica -  C. H. Josten, Ambix, 12:2-3 (1964): 82-221

I'll provide more recommended readings on the Monas Hieroglyphica in the third episode.

#dee #enochian #monas

title: Magic in Theory - The Stellar Ray Theory of Al-Kindi
description:
This episode is the first in a series focusing on theories of magic.  We begin with one of the most popular medieval theories:  the stellar rays of Al-Kindi.  Al-Kindi, a 9th century Islamicate philosopher, who argued that the stars emits rays which trickle down to the sub-lunar world where they qualify matter.  Further, all entities emit rays.  Certain occult or hidden rays can be manipulated by the sage to induce apparently supernatural or magical effects though speech, powerful symbols and animal sacrifice.  This idea provided a route to natural, as opposed to ritual/demonic, magic in the middle ages and underwrote much of astrological theory.  The stellar ray theory would also be built into the famous book of the magic the Picatrix which would be one of the earliest books learned magic to enter Western Europe.  Indeed, the argument in defense of occult forces in the universe is essential for modern physics.

Recommended readings:

Pormann and Peterson - The Philosophical Works of al-Kindi - 978-0199062805
 Liana Saif - The Arabic Influences on Early Modern Occult Philosophy - 978-1137399465
Al-Kindi - De Radiis (pp. 139-260) - Marie-Thérèse d'Alverny and Françoise HudryArchives d'histoire doctrinale et littéraire du Moyen Age, Vol. 41, 1974 - https://www.jstor.org/stable/i40184716
Al-Kindi: On the Stellar Rays - trans. Zoller and Hand - http://www.projecthindsight.com/archives/medieval%20contents/al-kindi.html
Esmé L K Partridge - Al-Kindi's Theory of The Magical Arts: A Commentary on Al-Kindi's Treatise 'On Rays' - https://www.academia.edu/36457042/Al-Kindis_Theory_of_The_Magical_Arts_A_Commentary_on_Al-Kindis_Treatise_On_Rays

#magic #astrology #alkindi

title: John Dee - The Monas Hieroglyphica - Part I - History and Context
description:
This is part one of a series discussing Dr. John Dee's revolutionary, though obscure, 1564 text the Monas Hieroglyphica (The Hieroglyphic Monad).  In part one we will discuss the philosophical and historical context of the text and present the main thesis of our analysis:  Dee is seeking to reform human knowledge through using a powerful symbol to purify specifically alchemy and cabala.  Part two will explore Dee's theory of alchemy and cabala and part three will show how the Hieroglyphic Monad has its power through combining the semiotic (representational) and the ontological (being itself).

These episodes represent a more introductory version of my thesis on the Monas Hieroglyphica prepared at the University of Amsterdam.

You can read the entire thesis here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1z3_C6qUjjeL58EciAl00iXOUWMoKAQtG/view?usp=sharing

Standard text and translation of the Monas Hieroglyphica -  C. H. Josten, Ambix, 12:2-3 (1964): 82-221

I'll provide more recommended readings on the Monas Hieroglyphica in the third episode.

#dee #enochian #monas

title: Magical Symbols - History of Sigils Angelic Alphabets and Symbols of Power
description:
This video traces the origin and development of magical symbols from late-classical Egypt through their development into Western European Magic.  These characters likely began as debased hieroglyphics and would eventually develop into unique symbols of power, the seals and sigils in angelic and demonic mage, and form the basis for angelic script / alphabets.  This video is a part of a series on magical and occult symbolism so make to subscribe if that interests you!

title: Greek Roman Egyptian Magic - Greek Magical Papyri - Books of Magic
description:
We explore the earliest collection of magical texts in the ancient world - The Greek Magical Papyri (PGM) and the Egyptian Demotic spells.  The PGM is the greatest collection of ancient magic.  Written on papyrus these collections of spells, incantations, evocations, represent the rich cross-pollination between various cultures, religious systems, and forms of magic and divination.  From Egyptian, Roman, Jewish, Greek cultures and religions emerges an amazing religious and magical syncretism.  This video introduces the PGM and discusses a collection of spells including: an invisibility lotion, the invocation of Helios, a rare example of lesbian love magic, a curse for your boss, magical athletic ability,  protection from demons, an anger management spell and more.  This video is part of a series on books of magic in history - subscribe for future videos!

Support Esoterica on Patreon:  https://www.patreon.com/esotericachannel

title: Kabbalah - Merkabah Hekhalot and Sar Torah Mysticism - Ancient Chariot and Angelic Kabbalah
description:
Jewish mysticism is one of the foundations for Western Esotericism and this video explores some of the earliest strata of those mystical texts.  In the Merkaba (chariot) / Hekhalot (palaces) texts mystics describe the terrifying and awe-inspiring descent - not ascent - into the divine palaces, meet with fearsome angels, gain control over angelic power, become transformed into beings of fire, and mount the very throne of G-d to carefully measure the vasts dimensions of the divine body.  This video also explores the Sar Torah (Torah Prince) literature where mystics engage in Jewish theurgy in order to gain immediate knowledge of legal, magical, and religious lore.  We also setup a future discussion of early Jewish magical texts such as the Sefer haRazim (The Book of Secrets) and the most obscure, taciturn, and amazing Sefer Yetzirah (Book of Formation).  

Support Esoterica on Patreon:  https://www.patreon.com/esotericachannel

This is the first in a series that will explore this more arcane side of western philosophy from ancient Greece to contemporary analytic and continental schools.

title: Esoterica Channel Trailer
description:
I'm Dr. Justin Sledge and welcome to Esoterica where we explore the arcane side of history, philosophy and religion.  

Support Esoterica:  https://www.patreon.com/esotericachannel

What is that arcane side?  We focus on concepts in what can broadly be called esotericism including:  magic, mysticism, alchemy, hermetic philosophy, theosophy, gnosticism, and more
